sentence.text: Patient 2 presented at 9 days with a mixed respiratory and metabolic acidosis.
Clinical examination showed thick scalp hair, a low anterior hair line, generalized hypertrichosis, and hepatomegaly (liver edge palpable 4 cm below the costal margin).
An echocardiogram confirmed a patent ductus arteriosus responsive to medical therapy.
At age 6 months her head circumference was 44 cm (90th centile), length 61.0 cm (10th centile), and weight 6.9 kg (50th centile).
Hepatomegaly was still present, with no signs of heart failure.
At age 2 years she was asymptomatic apart from frequent upper respiratory tract infections.
At this time the inter-ventricular septum measured 10 mm and posterior left ventricular wall 8 mm (normal range 5.5–7.5 mm) and there was mild tricuspid regurgitation.
When she was reviewed age 7 years she was well with a fit and muscular appearance.
She had thick hair on her head and mild generalized hypertrichosis with hair whorls on her back.
She had a formal developmental assessment which showed that her IQ was above average (full scale IQ 129, verbal IQ 135) but that she experienced some difficulties with fine motor coordination.
Aged 8 years she was admitted to hospital following an episode of hematemesis.
Her cardiomyopathy has remained stable and she does not have hepatomegaly.
She has continued to have reflux esophagitis.
She has done well in school and has gone on to tertiary education.
